title: Getting errors while installing truffle on my Windows 10
body:
PS C:\Windows\system32> npm install -g truffle@5.4.29
npm WARN deprecated mkdirp-promise@5.0.1: This package is broken and no longer maintained. 'mkdirp' itself supports promises now, please switch to that.

Because of the V8 engine whims, feature detection in old core-js versions could cause a slowdown up to 100x even if nothing is polyfilled. Please, upgrade your dependencies to the actual version of core-js.
[

npm ERR! gyp ERR! System Windows_NT 10.0.19044

npm ERR! gyp ERR! cwd C:\Users\HP\AppData\Roaming\npm\node_modules\truffle\node_modules\ganache\node_modules\keccak
npm ERR! gyp ERR! node -v v17.8.0
npm ERR! gyp ERR! node-gyp -v v9.0.0
npm ERR! gyp ERR! not ok

npm ERR! A complete log of this run can be found in:
npm ERR!     C:\Users\HP\AppData\Local\npm-cache\_logs\2022-04-07T04_59_28_578Z-debug-0.log

These are the errors that I am getting everytime.

Hey @Gursimranm4, normally errors like these come from using npm 8 without installing the extra build tools you are prompted to install during Node installation. There should be a checkbox during installation that you need to check to install the build tools. Also, don't use odd-numbered versions of Node as they are experimental (in this case Node 17). Try re-installing something like 16 and try again. 

You can also try downgrading npm to version 6 and re-installing. That should serve as a workaround if you don't want to do the above.

I see two different issues here, having just encountered both: The second post means you're missing build tools on your system; specifically Visual Studio.  The first post calls out a lot of warnings where Truffle is using deprecated packages, and that seems like something that should be fixed in code in this project.
Is there an open issue for the package deprecation warnings?
